name: Json.Helpers

types.name: ObjectEncoding
types.comment: This is an opaque type that is to be used to give hints when using the `TaggedObject` encoding.

values.comment: This is the old operator from Elm 0.17
The bind operator, which works like the old `andThen
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder a -> (a -> Json.Decode.Decoder b) -> Json.Decode.Decoder b

values.name: decodeMap
values.comment: Helper function for decoding map-like objects. It takes a decoder for the key type and a decoder for the value type.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder comparable -> Json.Decode.Decoder v -> Json.Decode.Decoder (Dict.Dict comparable v)

values.name: decodeSumObjectWithSingleField
values.comment:
Decode objects encoded using the `ObjectWithSingleField` scheme.
The first argument is the human readable name of the type of data, and will be used in error messages.
The second argument is a `Dict` where the keys are the tags of each constructor of the sum type and the values
are decoders for each case.
values.type: String -> Dict.Dict String (Json.Decode.Decoder a) -> Json.Decode.Decoder a

values.name: decodeSumTaggedObject
values.comment:
Decode objects encoded using the `TaggedObject` scheme.
The first argument is the human readable name of the type of data, and will be used in error messages.
The second argument is a `Dict` where the keys are the tags of each constructor of the sum type and the values
are decoders for each case.

Compared to the other functions, it expects a set of `String`s. This sets lists all the constructor tags that have an object content,
such as the `Baz` constructor in the example.
values.type: String -> String -> String -> Dict.Dict String (Json.Decode.Decoder a) -> Set.Set String -> Json.Decode.Decoder a

values.name: decodeSumTwoElemArray
values.comment:
Decode objects encoded using the `TwoElemArray` scheme.
The first argument is the human readable name of the type of data, and will be used in error messages.
The second argument is a `Dict` where the keys are the tags of each constructor of the sum type and the values
are decoders for each case.
values.type: String -> Dict.Dict String (Json.Decode.Decoder a) -> Json.Decode.Decoder a

values.name: decodeSumUnaries
values.comment: Helper for decoding enum-like sum types
values.type: String -> Dict.Dict String a -> Json.Decode.Decoder a

values.name: encodeMap
values.comment: Helper function for encoding map-like objects. It takes an encoder for the key type and an encoder for the value type
values.type: (comparable -> Json.Encode.Value) -> (v -> Json.Encode.Value) -> Dict.Dict comparable v -> Json.Encode.Value

values.name: encodeObject
values.comment: Creates an `ObjectEncoding`, just like the `Json.Encode.object` function.

values.name: encodeSumObjectWithSingleField
values.comment:
Encode objects using the `WithSingleField` scheme.
The first argument is a function that, for each possible value `a`, must return a `String` tag
describing it along with an `ObjectEncoding`.

values.name: encodeSumTaggedObject
values.comment:
Encode objects using the `TaggedObject` scheme.
The first argument is a function that, for each possible value `a`, must return a `String` tag
describing it along with an `ObjectEncoding`.
values.type: String -> String -> (a -> ( String, Json.Helpers.ObjectEncoding )) -> a -> Json.Decode.Value

values.name: encodeSumTwoElementArray
values.comment:
Encode objects using the `TwoElementArray` scheme.
The first argument is a function that, for each possible value `a`, must return a `String` tag
describing it along with an `ObjectEncoding`.

values.name: encodeValue
values.comment: Creates an `ObjectEncoding` from any type of `Value`. You should not use this for `Value`s that are actually objects.

values.name: jsonDecDict
values.comment: An alias to `decodeMap` that is compatible with the naming convention from `elm-bridge`
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder comparable -> Json.Decode.Decoder v -> Json.Decode.Decoder (Dict.Dict comparable v)

values.name: jsonEncDict
values.comment: An alias to `encodeMap` that is compatible with the naming convention from `elm-bridge`
values.type: (comparable -> Json.Encode.Value) -> (v -> Json.Encode.Value) -> Dict.Dict comparable v -> Json.Encode.Value

values.name: maybeEncode
values.comment: Encodes an optional value, using `null` when there is `Nothing`
